import React from 'react'; function Projects() { return (

Projects

Data and Machine Learning

COVID-19 Data Analysis Using SQL and Tableau

This project involves analyzing global COVID-19 datasets with advanced SQL techniques, including joins, CTEs, and window functions to uncover trends and patterns. The analysis is complemented by an interactive Tableau dashboard that visualizes key insights, such as case trends, mortality rates, and geographical impact. This project highlights proficiency in SQL for complex data manipulation and the use of Tableau for data visualization, providing a comprehensive overview of the pandemicâ€™s effects to support data-driven decision-making.

Data Cleaning and Correlation Analysis in Python

This project focused on cleaning and transforming raw housing datasets for enhanced analysis, leveraging Python's powerful libraries like Pandas, NumPy, and Matplotlib. The goal was to perform correlation analysis to identify key factors influencing revenue in the movie industry. The project highlights robust data wrangling techniques, exploratory data analysis (EDA), and effective use of visualizations to uncover trends and support data-driven insights, demonstrating proficiency in data preparation and statistical analysis.

Stock Market Price Prediction Using LSTM

This project involves developing a machine learning model using Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks to forecast stock prices for major companies. By leveraging Python libraries such as Keras, TensorFlow, NumPy, and scikit-learn, the model achieved a significant reduction in prediction error. The project showcases a deep learning approach to time-series forecasting, combining data preprocessing, model training, and evaluation to predict future stock trends, demonstrating strong skills in data science and machine learning.

Real-Time Stock Market Data Pipeline with Apache Kafka and AWS

Designed and implemented a real-time stock market data pipeline utilizing Apache Kafka on AWS EC2 for seamless data ingestion and processing. The pipeline integrates AWS services like S3, Glue, and Athena to automate data storage, transformation, and querying, ensuring scalability and reliability. This project demonstrates expertise in building efficient data engineering workflows and handling real-time streaming data, making it suitable for large-scale financial data analysis and reporting.



Cloud and DevOps & NSF

Indoor Navigation System for Assistive Technology

Contributed to an NSF-funded research project at WSU's ACCESS Lab, focusing on building an indoor navigation system to assist visually impaired and wheelchair users. Developed and managed an MS SQL database to store data from BLE beacons, optimizing data storage and enhancing proximity sensing for precise direction guidance. This project aimed to improve indoor accessibility, leveraging data-driven approaches for assistive technology, aligning with my focus on using data solutions for impactful real-world applications.

Netflix Clone Deployment Using Kubernetes

A Netflix Clone was deployed on Kubernetes, emphasizing advanced cloud automation and DevSecOps methodologies. The system utilized AWS EC2 for hosting, with Jenkins managing CI/CD pipelines, and SonarQube and Trivy enhancing security. Monitoring was handled through Prometheus and Grafana, while ArgoCD and Helm streamlined application deployment. This project demonstrates a deep understanding of container orchestration, security practices, and real-time system monitoring, showcasing skills in cloud infrastructure and continuous delivery.

); } export default Projects;
